means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 弗赖伊 Free的变体
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 弗赖伊绰号，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“矮小人，儿童，幼仔”(small person,child,offspring)
Ferry 渡口（街道标志缩写）

sentence.Network_en: Fry remaining peppers, adding a little more dressing if necessary.
sentence.Network_cn: 用油炸一下剩下的辣椒，如果需要再加点调味汁。

sentence.Network_en: Fry for about 4 minutes, until the onion has softened.
sentence.Network_cn: 煎4分钟左右，直到洋葱变软。

sentence.Network_en: Drop the slices into the oil and fry until golden brown.
sentence.Network_cn: 将切片倒进油里，煎至金棕色。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French frire, from Latin frigere
Middle English: from Old Norse frjó

entry.def: When you fry food, you cook it in a pan that contains hot fat or oil.

example.ex: Fry the breadcrumbs until golden brown.
example.tran: 把面包屑炸成金褐色为止。

entry.def: Fry are very small, young fish.
Fries are the same as French fries.

entry.tran: (尤指为尽快做好便饭)煎一下，炸一下
entry.def: If you fry up food, you fry it, especially in order to make a quick, casual meal.

example.ex: She cuts and fries the mixture up into a potato doughnut called Quin-Kuria.
example.tran: 她把混料切好后放进油里炸成一种叫做Quin-Kuria 的土豆炸面圈。

means.word_mean: 1. a young person of either sex;

sentences.sentence: "`tiddler' is a British term for youngsters"
"If the children stay out on the beach for another hour, they'll be fried"

means.word_mean: 2. cook on a hot surface using fat;
3. kill by electrocution, as in the electric chair;

Sentence.sentence: Burger King, the nation's second-largest fast food chain, for instance, will stop automatically including French fries and soda in its kids' meals starting this month, although they will still be available.

sentences.en: We'll fry if we stay too long in this hot sun.
sentences.cn: 我们如果在这样酷热的阳光下待久了, 皮肤会晒黑的。

jushi.english: We'll fry if we stay too long in this hot sun.
jushi.chinese: 我们如果在这样酷热的阳光下呆久了,皮肤会晒黑的。
